name: CopperCube 3D Scene
summary: Learn about .CCB files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: To create a CCB file simply select the floppy disk icon, or select File → Save or Save As..., name your file, choose the save location, and verify that the "CopperCube3D Document (*.ccb)" format is selected in the drop down menu, and click Save.
To import a CCB file, select File → Import → CopperCube Scene..., navigate to your file, and click Open.

You can use your CCB file to export contained meshes to different mesh files, such as .IRRMESH and .DAE files. To export to these files, select your object mesh, select File → Export → "Your desired format", name your file, choose the save location, and click Save.
NOTE: Coppercube is part of the CopperLicht SDK.

description: 3D document created by CopperCube, a 3D app, game, and website editor; contains a 3D scene, which includes scene settings, meshes, scene metrics, viewpoints, and links to files like .JPG and .PNG graphics that are referenced to make up the 3D objects in the scene.
